input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
The second week of the year was filled with a flurry of activity, both at home and at work. At the lab, we were deep into the planning stages of our new projects, with brainstorming sessions and design meetings taking place daily. I was particularly excited about a new collaboration with a local architectural firm, which could lead to some groundbreaking advancements in sustainable urban design. Meanwhile, at home, my wife and I were busy organizing the kids' schedules for the upcoming school year. We signed them up for various extracurricular activities, including soccer, art classes, and music lessons. The evenings were spent helping them with their homework and preparing healthy meals. The week ended on a high note with a family dinner, where we shared stories of our week and looked forward to the adventures that the new year would bring.

The third week of the year was marked by a sudden change in the weather. The temperatures rose dramatically, melting the snow and ice that had blanketed our neighborhood just a few days prior. The sudden thaw brought a sense of renewal, as the world around us came back to life. At work, we were making good progress on our projects, with several key milestones reached. I spent the week fine-tuning the design for the energy-efficient building project, working closely with the architects and engineers to ensure that every detail was perfect. At home, the kids were enjoying the warmer weather, playing outside and exploring the neighborhood. We took advantage of the mild temperatures to plan a family outing to the botanical gardens, where we spent the day marveling at the beauty of nature.

The week ended on a positive note, with the successful completion of a major project milestone.

The forty-ninth week of the year was a time for reflection and introspection, as we took stock of our progress and set new goals for the coming year. At work, we spent the week evaluating our projects and identifying areas for improvement, with a focus on innovation and efficiency. At home, we took the opportunity to reflect on our personal growth and set new goals for the coming year, from career aspirations to personal development to family and community involvement. By the end of the week, we were feeling a sense of clarity and purpose, with our vision for the future clear and our determination strong.

 Week 50 (December 9th - December 15th):
The fiftieth week of the year was a time for celebration and joy, as we prepared for the holiday season and the arrival of the new year. At home, we spent the week decorating our house and preparing special meals and treats for our family and friends. We also took the opportunity to connect with loved ones near and far, sharing stories and memories and expressing our love and appreciation for one another. By the end of the week, we were feeling a sense of warmth and joy, with our hearts full of love and our spirits uplifted.

 Week 51 (December 16th - December 22nd):
The fifty-first week of the year was a time for giving and generosity, as we expressed our love and appreciation for those around us through acts of kindness and charity. At work, we spent the week volunteering our time and resources to support local charities and causes, making a positive impact on our community. At home, we took the opportunity to give back to those in need, whether through donations, volunteering, or simply lending a helping hand. By the end of the week, we were feeling a sense of fulfillment and gratitude, with our hearts open to the world and our spirits enriched by the kindness and generosity of others.

 Week 52 (December 23rd - December 31st):
The fifty-second week of the year was a time for reflection and renewal, as we looked back on the past year and looked forward to the future with hope and anticipation. At home, we spent the week reflecting on our personal and professional growth and setting new goals and resolutions for the coming year. We also took the opportunity to connect with loved ones and friends, sharing stories and memories and expressing our love and appreciation for one another. By the end of the week, we were feeling a sense of closure and renewal, with our hearts filled with hope and our spirits ready for the new year.

1) Specific floors requirements:

  - Designate Floor 35 for small cinema use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 63 to 67 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 19 for pharmacy use.
  - Designate Floor 74 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for yoga studio use.
  - Designate Floor 10 for daycare center use.
  - Designate Floor 34 for photography studio use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 28 to 33 for a hospital with various departments.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The shrimp are succulent and sweet, while the cocktail sauce adds a tangy, spicy kick.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the savory, aromatic cheese filling.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich, velvety sauce clings to the tender lobster meat, creating a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin gives way to juicy, flavorful meat, while the sweet orange glaze adds a delightful contrast.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The subtle garlic flavor adds depth and complexity to the classic dish, making it a perfect accompaniment to the rich main courses.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze adds a touch of sweetness and a beautiful sheen to the carrots, making them a delightful and colorful addition to the meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and intense chocolate flavor make this a decadent and indulgent dessert that is sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are soft and spongey, while the creamy mascarpone cheese adds a rich, velvety texture.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. The sommelier will be happy to help you choose the perfect pairing for your dish.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features a selection of dishes that are both hearty and comforting, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread. The rich, savory flavors are balanced by the sweetness of the onions, making for a comforting and satisfying start to the meal.
1.2) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. The combination of the crispy bread, juicy tomatoes, and fragrant basil creates a delicious and refreshing appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French stew made with tender beef, red wine, and a variety of vegetables. The slow-cooked flavors meld together to create a rich, hearty dish that is sure to warm you up on a cold winter night.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with tender chicken, vegetables, and a flaky, buttery crust. The savory filling is topped with a golden, crispy crust that adds a delightful texture to the dish.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. The subtle sweetness of the potatoes is a perfect complement to the savory main courses.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Crispy green beans tossed with almonds and a buttery, garlic sauce. The crunchy almonds add a delightful texture and a nutty, savory flavor to the dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tart apples, a crispy oat topping, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The sweet, caramelized apples are topped with a crispy, crunchy oat topping, making for a delicious and comforting dessert.
4.2) Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake topped with a velvety chocolate ganache. The moist, chocolatey cake is a perfect indulgence for those with a sweet tooth.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A bold, full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting cup of hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cocoa powder.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu celebrates the flavors of the Mediterranean, with a focus on fresh, vibrant ingredients.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Hummus: A classic Middle Eastern dip made with chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice. The smooth, creamy texture and savory, slightly nutty flavor make it a perfect appetizer for sharing.
1.2) Falafel: Crispy, golden balls made from chickpeas, herbs, and spices. The savory, crunchy exterior gives way to a tender, flavorful interior, making for a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a tangy citrus glaze. The tender, flaky fish is infused with the smoky flavor of the grill, while the citrus glaze adds a delightful sweet-tart contrast.
2.2) Lamb Kebabs: Tender lamb skewers marinated in a fragrant blend of herbs and spices, grilled to perfection. The juicy, flavorful meat is a perfect complement to the fresh, vibrant flavors of the Mediterranean.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, fresh vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette. The nutty, slightly crunchy texture of the quinoa is a perfect complement to the fresh, crisp vegetables.
3.2) Grilled Vegetables: A colorful assortment of vegetables grilled to perfection and served with a fragrant herb oil. The smoky, charred flavor of the vegetables is a perfect complement to the fresh, vibrant flavors of the Mediterranean.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern dessert made with layers of phyllo dough, honey, and nuts. The crispy, golden layers are infused with a sweet, sticky honey syrup, making for a delicious and indulgent dessert.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A sweet, chewy dessert made with rosewater, chopped nuts, and a gelatin-like texture. The delicate, fragrant flavor of the rosewater is a perfect complement to the nutty, chewy texture of the dessert.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the light, vibrant flavors of the Mediterranean dishes.
5.2) Mint Tea: A refreshing cup of mint tea, perfect for cleansing the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Asia, with a focus on bold, savory flavors and fragrant spices.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Edamame: Tender, young soybeans served with a savory, slightly spicy sea salt. The nutty, slightly sweet flavor of the edamame is a perfect appetizer for sharing.
1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy, golden rolls filled with a savory mixture of vegetables and meat. The crunchy exterior gives way to a tender, flavorful interior, making for a delicious and satisfying appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Teriyaki Chicken: Tender, juicy chicken breasts marinated in a sweet, savory teriyaki sauce and grilled to perfection. The sticky, flavorful sauce clings to the tender chicken, creating a delicious and satisfying dish.
2.2) Pad Thai: A classic Thai dish made with stir-fried rice noodles, shrimp, vegetables, and a tangy, sweet-savory sauce. The complex flavors and textures make for a delicious and satisfying main course.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A flavorful dish made with rice, vegetables, and a savory, slightly spicy sauce. The crispy, golden rice is infused with the savory flavors of the vegetables and the fragrant spices, making for a delicious and satisfying side dish.
3.2) Steamed Broccoli: Tender, crisp broccoli steamed to perfection and served with a fragrant, savory soy sauce. The subtle sweetness of the broccoli is a perfect complement to the bold, savory flavors of the Asian dishes.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Mochi: A traditional Japanese dessert made with sweet rice cake and a filling of red bean paste or ice cream. The chewy, slightly elastic texture of the mochi is a perfect complement to the sweet, rich filling.
4.2) Green Tea Ice Cream: A refreshing, subtly sweet ice cream infused with the delicate, fragrant flavor of green tea. The smooth, creamy texture and subtle sweetness make for a perfect dessert to end the meal.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: A traditional Japanese rice wine, perfect for pairing with the bold, savory flavors of the Asian dishes.
5.2) Green Tea: A refreshing cup of green tea, perfect for cleansing the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Italy, with a focus on rich, savory flavors and fragrant herbs.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh basil, and a drizzle of olive oil. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the tomatoes are beautifully complemented by the fragrant basil and the crispy, toasted bread.
1.2) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. The sweet, juicy tomatoes are a perfect complement to the creamy, slightly tangy mozzarella, while the balsamic vinegar adds a delightful sweet-tart contrast.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Spaghetti Bolognese: A classic Italian dish made with spaghetti and a rich, savory meat sauce. The tender, flavorful meat is infused with the fragrant flavors of garlic, onion, and tomatoes, creating a delicious and satisfying main course.
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: A breaded and fried chicken cutlet topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese. The crispy, golden exterior gives way to tender, juicy chicken, while the rich, savory flavors of the marinara sauce and melted cheese create a delicious and satisfying dish.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy, garlic-infused mashed potatoes. The subtle sweetness of the potatoes is beautifully complemented by the fragrant, savory flavors of the garlic, making for a delicious and satisfying side dish.
3.2) Roasted Vegetables: A colorful assortment of vegetables roasted to perfection and seasoned with fragrant herbs and spices. The subtle sweetness of the vegetables is beautifully complemented by the savory, fragrant flavors of the herbs and spices.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: A classic Italian dessert made with ladyfingers, espresso, and a rich, creamy mascarpone filling. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are a perfect complement to the rich, creamy mascarpone filling, creating a delicious and indulgent dessert.
4.2) Gelato: A traditional Italian ice cream made with milk, sugar, and flavorings. The smooth, creamy texture and rich, intense flavors make for a perfect dessert to end the meal.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Chianti: A classic Italian red wine, perfect for pairing with the rich, savory flavors of the Italian dishes.
5.2) Espresso: A strong, rich cup of espresso, perfect for ending the meal on a bold, flavorful note.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - 11th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of Mexico, with a focus on bold, spicy flavors and fresh, vibrant ingredients.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Guacamole: A classic Mexican dip made with ripe avocados, lime juice, onion, cilantro, and jalapeño peppers. The creamy, slightly tangy avocados are beautifully complemented by the bold, spicy flavors of the jalapeño peppers and the fragrant, herbal flavors of the cilantro.
1.2) Quesadillas: A classic Mexican dish made with a tortilla filled with cheese, beans, and other fillings, grilled until crispy and melted. The crispy, golden tortilla is a perfect complement to the melted, gooey cheese and the savory, slightly sweet flavors of the beans.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Tacos Al Pastor: A classic Mexican dish made with marinated pork, pineapple, and onions, served on a corn tortilla. The savory, slightly sweet flavors of the marinated pork are beautifully complemented by the sweet, juicy pineapple and the slightly crunchy, slightly spicy onions.
2.2) Enchiladas: A classic Mexican dish made with corn tortillas filled with chicken, cheese, and other fillings, covered in a chili sauce and baked until bubbly and golden. The savory, slightly spicy flavors of the chili sauce are beautifully complemented by the tender, juicy chicken and the melted, gooey cheese.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Rice and Beans: A classic Mexican side dish made with rice and beans, seasoned with fragrant herbs and spices. The subtle sweetness of the rice is beautifully complemented by the savory, slightly spicy flavors of the beans.
3.2) Elote: Grilled corn on the cob slathered with mayonnaise, chili powder, and lime juice. The sweet, juicy corn is beautifully complemented by the savory, slightly spicy flavors of the chili powder and the tangy, slightly sweet flavors of the mayonnaise and lime juice.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Churros: A classic Mexican dessert made with fried dough, coated in cinnamon sugar, and served with a chocolate dipping sauce. The crispy, golden exterior of the churros is beautifully complemented by the sweet, slightly spicy flavors of the cinnamon sugar and the rich, decadent flavors of the chocolate dipping sauce.
4.2) Flan: A classic Mexican dessert made with caramelized sugar, eggs, milk, and vanilla. The silky, creamy texture of the flan is beautifully complemented by the sweet, slightly bitter flavors of the caramelized sugar and the subtle, delicate flavors of the vanilla.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Margarita: A classic Mexican cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and triple sec. The bold, spicy flavors of the tequila are beautifully complemented by the sweet, tangy flavors of the lime juice and the slightly sweet, slightly floral flavors of the triple sec.
5.2) Horchata: A traditional Mexican rice drink, made with rice, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla. The subtle sweetness of the rice is beautifully complemented by the fragrant, slightly spicy flavors of the cinnamon and the subtle, delicate flavors of the vanilla.
 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - 18th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of India, with a focus on fragrant spices and bold, savory flavors.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Samosas: Triangular-shaped pastries filled with spiced potatoes, peas, and lentils. The crispy, golden exterior of the samosas is beautifully complemented by the savory, slightly sweet flavors of the spiced potatoes and the subtle, earthy flavors of the peas and lentils.
1.2) Pakora: Crispy fritters made with chickpea flour, vegetables, and spices. The crispy, golden exterior of the pakora is beautifully complemented by the savory, slightly sweet flavors of the vegetables and the fragrant, slightly spicy flavors of the spices.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Butter Chicken: A classic Indian dish made with tender chicken pieces cooked in a rich, buttery tomato-based sauce. The tender, juicy chicken is beautifully complemented by the rich, savory flavors of the butter and the tangy, slightly sweet flavors of the tomatoes.
2.2) Biryani: A fragrant Indian rice dish made with basmati rice, meat, vegetables, and a variety of spices. The fragrant, slightly spicy flavors of the rice and spices are beautifully complemented by the tender, juicy meat and the subtle, earthy flavors of the vegetables.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Naan Bread: A classic Indian flatbread, perfect for soaking up the rich, savory flavors of the main courses. The soft, slightly chewy texture of the naan bread is beautifully complemented by the subtle, slightly sweet flavors of the garlic and the fragrant, slightly spicy flavors of the coriander.
3.2) Raita: A cooling Indian side dish made with yogurt, cucumber, and spices. The cool, refreshing flavors of the yogurt and cucumber are beautifully complemented by the fragrant, slightly spicy flavors of the spices, making for a perfect accompaniment to the bold, savory flavors of the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Gulab Jamun: A classic Indian dessert made with fried dough balls soaked in a sweet, syrupy sugar syrup. The soft, slightly chewy texture of the dough balls is beautifully complemented by the sweet, slightly sticky flavors of the sugar syrup, making for a perfect, indulgent treat.
4.2) Mango Kulfi: A traditional Indian ice cream made with ripe mangoes and milk. The sweet, juicy flavors of the mangoes are beautifully complemented by the rich, creamy texture of the ice cream, making for a perfect, refreshing dessert.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Masala Chai: A fragrant Indian tea made with a blend of spices, milk, and black tea. The fragrant, slightly spicy flavors of the tea and spices are beautifully complemented by the rich, creamy texture of the milk, making for a perfect, warming beverage.
5.2) Mango Lassi: A classic Indian drink made with ripe mangoes, yogurt, and sugar. The sweet, juicy flavors of the mangoes are beautifully complemented by the tangy, slightly sour flavors of the yogurt and the subtle, slightly sweet flavors of the sugar, making for a perfect, refreshing beverage.
 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - 25th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean, with a focus on fresh, vibrant ingredients and bold, savory flavors.
1. Appetizers:

3.2) Greek Salad: A classic Mediterranean salad made with fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, feta cheese, olives, and a tangy vinaigrette. 4.2) Turkish Delight: A traditional Turkish dessert made with a gel-like base flavored with rosewater, pistachios, and other nuts. 5.2) Mint Tea: A fragrant Moroccan tea made with green tea, mint leaves, and sugar. The subtle, slightly sweet flavors of the tea and mint are beautifully complemented by the cooling, refreshing flavors of the mint, making for a perfect, soothing beverage.
 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th):
This week's menu features dishes inspired by the bold, savory flavors and rich textures of the Middle East.
1. Appetizers:

 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - March 11th):

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.

1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.

This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crispy crumb topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A decadent pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a buttery pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting beverage made with real chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to start the year off on a healthy note.
1. Appetizers:

This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those who enjoy a little heat in their meals.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th):

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th):

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken breast smothered in a creamy Alfredo sauce, served over pasta.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese baked to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
3.2) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, pasta, and vegetables.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm, sweet dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich, velvety cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a tangy lemon zest topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Assorted Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Lemonade: A refreshing, tangy beverage to complement the lighter dishes.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread topped with tomatoes, garlic, basil, and mozzarella.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Delicate crab cakes made with jumbo lump crab meat, served with a tangy remoulade sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, hearty stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Vegetarian Paella: A colorful, flavorful rice dish made with saffron, vegetables, and beans.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Green Beans Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with almonds and browned butter.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Brownies: Fudgy, decadent chocolate brownies topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Crème Brûlée: A classic French dessert with a rich, creamy custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing, non-alcoholic beverage to cleanse the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with tomatoes, onions, and cilantro.
1.2) Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles: Triangles of phyllo dough filled with spinach, feta cheese, and garlic, baked until crispy.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Veal Parmesan: Tender veal cutlets breaded and fried, topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
2.2) Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers: Bell peppers stuffed with rice, beans, corn, and cheese, baked until tender.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Quinoa Salad: A light, refreshing salad made with quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, and avocado, dressed with a citrus vinaigrette.
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted until tender and caramelized, finished with a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy, sweet dessert made with a lemon curd filling and a buttery, flaky crust.
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Warm, gooey chocolate chip cookies served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp, refreshing white wine to complement the lighter dishes.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, decadent hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and marshmallows.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
Valentine's Day Special.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served on the half shell, accompanied by a mignonette sauce.
1.2) Chocolate-Covered Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in melted chocolate and served on a bed of fresh raspberries.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Surf and Turf: A succulent steak paired with fresh grilled shrimp, served with a red wine reduction sauce.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna Rolls: Lasagna noodles stuffed with spinach, ricotta cheese, and marinara sauce, baked until golden.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes infused with the flavor of roasted garlic.
3.2) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until tender and finished with a drizzle of olive oil and lemon juice.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake: A decadent, moist red velvet cake shaped like a heart, topped with cream cheese frosting.
4.2) Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in melted chocolate and served on a plate.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Champagne: A bottle of chilled champagne to toast the special occasion.
5.2) Raspberry Lemonade: A refreshing, fruity beverage to complement the sweet desserts.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - 11th):
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta with Tomato and Mozzarella: Toasted bread topped with ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy, warm dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and garlic, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Parmesan: A breaded and fried chicken cutlet topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese.
2.2) Vegetarian Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms: Large portobello mushrooms stuffed with quinoa, black beans, and corn, baked until tender.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Vegetables: A colorful assortment of vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita chips.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, brown sugar, and a hint of cinnamon.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, topped with a crispy crumb topping.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich, nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm, comforting drink made with rich chocolate and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to detox after the holiday season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with salt, perfect for a light and healthy snack.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: A healthy and flavorful dish made with fresh salmon, seasoned with lemon and herbs, and grilled to perfection.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A hearty and nutritious salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Brown Rice: A simple and healthy side dish made with nutty brown rice.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Tart: A delicious dessert made with a tart shell and fresh fruit, topped with a sweet glaze.
4.2) Sorbet: A refreshing and light dessert made with fruit and sugar, served in scoops.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Green Tea: A healthy and refreshing drink made with steeped green tea leaves.
5.2) Sparkling Water: A light and bubbly drink perfect for those looking to avoid alcohol.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those looking to add some excitement to their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spicy Tuna Roll: A classic sushi roll made with spicy tuna, avocado, and cucumber, wrapped in nori and served with soy sauce.
1.2) Jalapeno Poppers: Fried jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and bacon, served with a tangy dipping sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chicken Vindaloo: A spicy Indian dish made with chicken, potatoes, and a complex blend of spices.
2.2) Shrimp Curry: A flavorful and spicy dish made with shrimp, coconut milk, and a variety of aromatic spices.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Naan Bread: A soft and fluffy Indian flatbread perfect for soaking up the flavors of the curries.
3.2) Basmati Rice: A fragrant and aromatic rice dish that complements the bold flavors of the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chai Tea Pudding: A rich and creamy dessert made with chai tea, milk, and sugar, topped with a dollop of whipped cream.
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet and sticky dessert made with mango, rice, and coconut milk, served with a drizzle of sweetened condensed milk.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing and sweet drink made with ripe mangoes, yogurt, and sugar.
5.2) Spicy Bloody Mary: A bold and spicy cocktail made with vodka, tomato juice, and a variety of spices.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): Squash and Pumpkin Delights
This week, we celebrate the bounty of winter squash and pumpkins with a variety of delicious dishes.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Butternut Squash Soup: A creamy and comforting soup made with roasted butternut squash, onions, and garlic.
1.2) Pumpkin Ravioli: Tender ravioli filled with pumpkin puree, served with a sage brown butter sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Roasted Acorn Squash: Halved acorn squash roasted until tender and caramelized, topped with a maple glaze and served with a side of quinoa.
2.2) Pumpkin Risotto: A rich and creamy risotto made with pumpkin puree, Arborio rice, and Parmesan cheese.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Tender Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy and seasoned with garlic and olive oil.
3.2) Sweet Potato Mash: A sweet and creamy side dish made with mashed sweet potatoes, brown sugar, and butter.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Pumpkin Pie: A classic dessert made with pumpkin puree, evaporated milk, and spices, topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Sweet Potato Casserole: A sweet and savory casserole made with sweet potatoes, brown sugar, and marshmallows, topped with a crispy pecan crumb topping.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Apple Cider: A warm and comforting drink made with fresh apple cider, cinnamon sticks, and a hint of cloves.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - 11th): Seafood Delights

This week, we celebrate the rich and flavorful cuisine of Italy with a variety of delicious dishes.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - 25th): Asian Delights

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week's menu features dishes that are hearty and warming, perfect for the chilly winter weather.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) French Onion Soup: A classic soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and crusty bread.
1.2) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked until melted and served with a fruit compote and baguette slices.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A rich, slow-cooked stew made with beef, red wine, onions, carrots, and mushrooms.
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A comforting dish made with chicken, vegetables, and a flaky pie crust.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted until tender and caramelized.
3.2) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with a touch of brown sugar and butter.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with apples, oats, and brown sugar, baked until golden and crispy.
4.2) Pecan Pie: A rich and nutty pie made with pecans, corn syrup, and a flaky pie crust.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the hearty main courses.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A warm and comforting beverage made with rich cocoa and milk.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week's menu features dishes that are light and refreshing, perfect for those looking to detox after the holiday season.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Caprese Salad: A classic Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
1.2) Edamame: Steamed soybeans seasoned with sea salt, a popular Japanese appetizer.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce.
2.2) Quinoa Salad: A hearty salad made with quinoa, vegetables, and a tangy vinaigrette.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled until slightly charred and seasoned with olive oil and salt.
3.2) Roasted Beets: Roasted beets served with a tangy vinaigrette, a colorful and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Fruit Tart: A classic French dessert made with a tart shell and fresh fruit.
4.2) Sorbet: A refreshing and light dessert made with fruit and sugar, served frozen.
5. Drinks:
5.1) White Wine: A crisp and refreshing white wine to pair with the light main courses.
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing and caffeine-free beverage made with black tea and served over ice.
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week's menu features dishes that are spicy and bold, perfect for those looking to add some excitement to their meals.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Spicy Tuna Roll: A classic sushi roll made with spicy tuna, avocado, and cucumber.
1.2) Jalapeno Poppers: Jalapeno peppers stuffed with cream cheese and breadcrumbs, baked until golden and crispy.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Chili Con Carne: A hearty and spicy stew made with beef, beans, and chili peppers.
2.2) Pad Thai: A popular Thai dish made with rice noodles, vegetables, and a spicy peanut sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Fried Rice: A flavorful side dish made with rice, vegetables, and scrambled eggs.
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Sautéed spinach seasoned with garlic and chili flakes, a healthy and delicious side dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chili Chocolate Cake: A decadent dessert made with chili powder and rich chocolate, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet and spicy dessert made with mango, rice, and coconut milk.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Margarita: A classic Mexican cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and triple sec.
5.2) Sangria: A refreshing and fruity drink made with red wine, fruit, and brandy.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
This week marks the beginning of Seafood Season Extravaganza, featuring a variety of delicious seafood dishes.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in lime juice, mixed with onions, tomatoes, and cilantro.
1.2) Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served on the half shell, accompanied by a mignonette sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Swordfish: Grilled swordfish served with a citrus glaze and a side of quinoa.
2.2) Lobster Bisque: A rich and creamy soup made with lobster, onions, and heavy cream.
3. Side Dishes:

Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for botanical garden use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 5) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (6, 9) for farm use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 6) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 7) for botanical garden use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the row from (7, 2) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0):

The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
